article_title: Cold Weather to Damp German Growth, Berliner Zeitung Says
article_text: SHARE THIS ARTICLE   Share   Tweet   Post   Email  {"contentId":"LDTNK307SXKX01","position":"brokerboxarticle","dimensions":{"large_desktop":[[120,60]],"small_desktop":[[120,60]],"tablet":[[120,60]]},"strategy":"viewable","positionIncrement":1,"targeting":{"position":"brokerboxarticle1","url":"/news/articles/2010-12-22/cold-weather-to-damp-german-growth-berliner-zeitung-says"},"containerId":"brokerboxarticle-64J8GoO"}   The winter weather in Germany will damp the country’s quarterly economic growth by half a percentage point, Berliner Zeitung said, citing Volker Treier, chief economist at the DIHK Chamber of Commerce and Industry.    Snow and frost will crimp December earnings at Deutsche Bahn AG, Germany’s state-owned railway, and cut construction industry sales in half, the newspaper said, citing company and business lobby spokespeople it didn’t name. Traffic delays are hampering manufacturing output, it said.     Published on ‎22‎ ‎December‎, ‎2010‎ ‎10‎:‎48        Have a confidential tip for our reporters?
